result.execSummary:
The defendant Wendell Oliveras was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs, DNA surcharge and Buy Money are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Buy money is to be paid joint/several with co-actor (Jose Valle-Teron) within the first year of probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the co-actors listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 90 DAYS are to be served Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions, INCLUDING elder care).  Defendant to report to huber by 07:00 p.m. on 12-05-2016.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County and under any conditions to facilitate transfer to Milwaukee County.
LAST 90 DAYS are STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Wendell Oliveras in court with attorney Roberto R Ledesma by Atty. Rodriguez.  
Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Sworn in.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendation.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  4 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Co-Actors listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

Buy Money:  $700 joint/several with co-actor Jose Valle-Teron (to be paid before costs or fines) - To paid within first year of probation;

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probaton.

CONDITION TIME:
180 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions, including elder case).
First 90 Days to be served at huber - Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County and under any conditions to facilitate transfer to Milwaukee.
Defendant to report to huber by 7 pm. on 12/05/16.
Last 90 Days - STAYED - To be used at the agents discretion.
